_header: Sithen law for will beginneth to slacken
Subjects: evils of the times; sermons, verse in
_description: On the Degeneracy of the Times (5 lines, aabbb), a tag in the Fasciculus morum

Bod187.First Lines:
Syþþe lawe for wyl by gynnyþ to slakeAnd falsehede
                    for slynesse ys y take…
Bod187.Last Lines:
…And wantomnesse ys holdyn solasþenne may yngelonde synge
                    alas

Bod410.First Lines:
Sythen þat lawe for wille bygynne to shakenAnd falshed for
                    sleyght is I taken…
Bod410.Last Lines:
…And foul fals lecchery is pryuy solasNow may Ingelond syngen
                    alas
Bod410.Editions:
Little,  Andrew George. 
             Studies in English Franciscan History.
         Manchester: Manchester UP; London: Longman’s, 1917: 155, n. 3.

BodLauMis213.Transcription:
Stihen (sic) law for will bygynnyþ to slakynAnd falshede
                    for slegheis turned and takenrobbynge and renyng is holden purchasand
                    alle maner synne mad solasEnglond may sing alas alas

BodRawC670.Transcription:
Sithyn law for wyll bygynnyt to slakynAnd falsehed for [sleythe] is i
                    takynRobbyng and reuyng ys holdyn purchasAnd of vnthewes is made
                    solasEngelond may synge alas alas
BodRawC670.Editions:
Silverstein,  Theodore,
                        ed.  
             Medieval English Lyrics.
         York Medieval Texts. London: Edw. Arnold, 1971: 98.

CamGon71.Transcription:
Syn lawe for will begynnes to slaken& falsed for sleyth now is
                    takenRobbyng & rewyng is holden purchas& of vnclennes is made
                    solasEnglond may say & syng Allas allas
CamGon71.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Historical Poems of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         New York: Columbia UP, 1959: 145-6.

CamStJohn159.Transcription:
Sethen law for wylle begynnes to slakeneAnd falsode for sleȝt is
                    itakeneRobbynge and renynge ys haldyn purchaseAnd of wantonese is
                    mayden solaseInglande may synge alas alas

EDU82.First Lines:
Syuthen lawe for wyll be gynnes to slakenAnd falshede for sleyth is
                    taken…
EDU82.Last Lines:
…Robbyng and rewyng is halden purchasAnd of on wantownes is
                    maden solasEngelonde may synge alas alas

Lincoln44.Transcription:
Sythen law for wille by gynyþ to slakyn& falsed for sleyth
                    ys y takenRobbyng and rewyng ys holden purchasAnd of on þewys ys
                    maden solasEngelond may synge alas alas

Spalding.Transcription:
Robbyng & reuyng is holden purchasAnd of vnthewes is made
                    solaceþerfore we may say alas alas
Spalding.Note: Omits first two lines; written as prose.

WorcF19.Transcription:
Sythyn lawe for wille by gynuth to sclakyn& falshede
                        for sleyth is I takynRobbyng & reuyng his holdyn
                    purchasAnd of wirthe wys is mad solasEngelond may synge alas
                    alas
